intro: Trophaeum bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive appearance, featuring two different colorations on its lobed leaves, typically green and reddish. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its structure consists of a thallus with distinct leaf-like structures called phyllodes. Trophaeum bicolor plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
